A '''spear''' is a [[tiered]] melee [[weapon]] that can be used to perform slow {{Control|attack|text=jab attacks}} or held forward to do {{Control|use|text=charge attacks}} which deal [[damage]] based on the velocity of the user and the target. Spears have especially long reach, but cannot hit targets that are too close.

== Variants ==
There are seven spear variants:
* {{ItemLink|Wooden Spear}}
* {{ItemLink|Golden Spear}}
* {{ItemLink|Stone Spear}}
* {{ItemLink|Copper Spear}}
* {{ItemLink|Iron Spear}}
* {{ItemLink|Diamond Spear}}
* {{ItemLink|Netherite Spear}}

=== Mob loot ===
[[Zombie]]s, [[husk]]s, [[zombie horsemen]], and [[camel husk jockey]] riders can spawn wielding iron spears, while [[piglin]]s and [[zombified piglin]]s can spawn wielding golden spears. These spears have an 8.5% chance of dropping upon death, increased to a maximum of 11.5% with the Looting III enchantment.

It is also possible to get the golden spear from a piglin by dropping a [[crossbow]] or [[sword]] nearby, which the piglin will swap its spear for. It then requires precise timing to pick it up before the piglin does.

=== Attacking ===
[[File:Weapon reach comparison.gif|thumb|Comparing the reach of other weapons (3 blocks) to the spear (4.5 blocks).]]
Spears have a longer attack range than other weapons, at 4.5 blocks rather than 3 blocks. However, they also have a minimum attack range value that prevents attacking entities that are within 2 blocks of the user.<ref group="note">The minimum attack range for non-player entities inside of a charge attack is 1 block, whilst the maximum is 2.25 blocks.</ref> Unlike all other weapons, including a bare hand, spears cannot do [[critical hit]]s or [[sprint-knockback attack]]s.<ref>{{cite bug|MC|302782|Spears do not activate critical hits or sprint-knockback attacks when meeting the appropriate conditions|resolution=Works As Intended}}</ref>

[[File:Spear hitbox inflation.gif|thumb|The 0.125 hitbox margin on spear attacks.]]
Spears can damage multiple entities with a single attack. Spears [[Hitbox margin|inflate the hitboxes]] of targets by 0.125 when calculating hit registration, giving them more effective area. It is not possible to break blocks while holding a spear, and instead an attack is performed. Spears have the unique ability to attack through non-solid blocks like [[cobweb]]s and [[tall grass]]. {{IN|Java}}, spear attacks (both jab and charge attacks) are also uniquely capable of causing horizontal knockback to [[primed TNT]]. Spears have two methods of attacking:

==== Jab attack ====
A spear can be used with the {{ctrl|attack}} button to perform a jab attack, dealing damage depending on the [[tier]] of the spear. Jab attacks have a unique type of cooldown that cannot be bypassed:
* {{IN|JE}}, they use a variant of the [[attack cooldown]] where attacking is not possible until 100% charge, unlike other weapons.
* {{IN|BE}}, they instead have a [[use cooldown]] like that of an [[ender pearl]], creating a similar forced-cooldown effect. The use cooldown triggers for all spear tiers in the inventory, not only the tier that was jabbed with.
A spear can still perform a charge attack while the jab attack is on cooldown, and thus by alternating between jab attacks and charge attacks the rate of attacks can be effectively doubled. Jab attacks do one additional damage in {{BE}} compared to {{JE}}.<ref>{{cite bug|MC|304490|Spear jab attack damage does not match Bedrock Edition|resolution=Works As Intended}}</ref> The jab attack of copper spears is strictly worse than stone spears, due to having a lower attack speed{{Only|Java|short=1}} / longer use cooldown{{Only|Bedrock|short=1}} with identical attack damage.<ref>{{cite bug|MC|304382|Copper spear does the exact same damage as a stone spear while having worse cooldowns|resolution=Works As Intended}}</ref> Switching to a spear in {{BE}} does not cause the use cooldown to need to charge, unlike the attack cooldown in {{JE}}.

==== Charge attack ====
{{redirect|Charge||Charge (disambiguation)}}
The spear can alternatively be lowered into an attack position by holding the {{ctrl|use}} button, where colliding with a target deals damage depending on the velocity of the user and the velocity of the target. Charge attacks can hit multiple entities, and in {{BE}} there is a 0.5 second (10 tick) delay between charge attack connections. A charge attack can be dealt even when the jab attack is on cooldown. Charge attacks go through three stages when held out:

[[File:Spear charge attack stages.gif|thumb|The three stages of a charge attack: engaged, tired, and disengaged.]]
* Engaged
** The first state of a charge attack, indicated by the spear being held out steadily.
** The attack deals [[damage]], inflicts [[Knockback (mechanic)|knockback]], and dismounts attacked targets from their [[mount]]s.
* Tired
** The second state of a charge attack, indicated by the spear rotating sideways and shaking.
** The attack deals damage and inflicts knockback.
* Disengaged
** The final state of a charge attack, indicated by the spear being lowered down to the bottom of the screen.
** The attack only deals damage.

Charge attacks can still deal damage while the user is standing still, if the target is moving towards the user. The damage done by the charge attack is its [[#Multipliers|damage multiplier]] multiplied by the velocity of the attacker relative to the target in blocks per second. Charge attacks are not influenced by the [[Strength]] or [[Weakness]] effects.<ref>{{cite bug|MC|302778|Strength, Weakness and any other attack_damage attribute modifiers do not impact damage dealt by spears when performing charge attacks|resolution=Unresolved}}</ref> {{IN|Bedrock}}, spear charge attacks produce critical hit particles when striking targets, but they aren't actually critical hits. A charge attack can be canceled at any time, regardless of the stage it's in. When doing a charge attack directly after a jab attack, the spear will perform the jab animation and then flourish into the charge attack position in two rotations.{{Only|Java|short=1}}<ref>{{cite bug|MC|304792|Starting to charge immediately after jabbing with a spear causes it to rotate 270 degrees in third person mode|resolution=Works As Intended}}</ref>

==== Tier ====
The [[tier]] of a given spear slightly alters the behavior of jab and charge attacks:
; Positive effects of higher tiers
* Higher <abbr title="Used by jab attacks.">attack damage</abbr> and <abbr title="Used by charge attacks.">attack multipliers</abbr> than lower tiered spears.
* Charge attacks start up faster than lower tiered spears.

; Negative effects of higher tiers
* Jab attacks have longer attack cooldowns in ''Java Edition'', and longer use cooldowns in ''Bedrock Edition''.
* Charge attacks progress through their charge attack states faster, losing their dismounting effect and ability to do knockback earlier than lower tiered spears.
* Charge attacks have a longer recovery time after progressing through all three stages.

=== Usage by mobs ===
[[Zombie]]s, [[husk]]s, [[zombified piglin]]s, [[zombie villager]]s{{only|java}}, and [[piglin]]s wielding spears have unique attacking behavior. When attacking, they use the spear's charge attack while moving towards their target. They hold the charge through its full duration, using all 3 stages. Once the charge attack has ended, they walk away to increase the distance between them and their target before turning around to begin another charge.

When wielded by any other mob, such as [[skeleton]]s, they instead use the spear's jab attack when in melee range. Like players, the 2-4.5 blocks attacking range applies to these mobs as well. The Lunge enchantment will also take effect for these mobs.

==== Anvil repair ====
{{main|Anvil mechanics#Unit repair}}
{{Repairing with Anvils|Spear}}

A spear can be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding units of the [[tiers]]' repair material, with each repair material restoring 25% the spear's maximum durability, rounded down. Two spears of the same tier can also be combined in an anvil with an extra 12% durability, {{in|bedrock}} the extra durability is approximately 6% for this item.<ref group="note" name="molang /> Both methods preserve the spear's [[enchantment]]s.

==== Enchantment behavior ====
Spears have exclusive access to the [[Lunge]] enchantment.

===== Lunge =====
[[File:Lunge charge attack synergy.gif|thumb|Starting a charge attack immediately after doing a jab attack with a Lunge spear.]]
{{main|Lunge}}
Spears [[Enchanting#Summary_of_enchantments_by_item|enchanted]] with [[Lunge]] propel the player forward when a jab attack is performed, at the cost of consuming [[saturation]] and [[hunger]] points at an amount dependent on the enchantment level, as well as consuming 1 durability. Saturation points are consumed first, and then hunger points are consumed after. Lunge does not trigger when the player has less than 6 hunger points, is riding a mount, is gliding with an elytra, or if the user is in water. Level I consumes 1 saturation/hunger points, level II takes 2 saturation/hunger points, and level III takes 3 saturation/hunger points.

By initiating a charge attack directly after a jab attack, the charge attack can be connected using the velocity gained with Lunge. There must be significant distance between the user and the target to give time for the charge attack's activation delay to fully finish after jabbing.

|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre1|Charge attacks no longer have a delay for connecting repeatedly against a single entity (was previously 0.5 seconds or 10 ticks). However, in practice only [[Knockback (mechanic)|knockback]] is dealt after the first hit connects unless the target is against a wall, with no damage being dealt.<ref>{{cite bug|MC|304365|Spear charge attacks do not continue to do damage against a single target|resolution=Works As Intended}}</ref>|The hitbox margin on spear jab attacks that made attacks easier to land has been reduced from <code>0.25</code> to <code>0.125</code>, now matching charge attacks.|Changed the swap animation scale of all spears from {{cd|1.9}} to {{cd|1.95}}.|The on-hover attack indicator now accurately indicates when a spear will connect an attack, now accounting for its different reach and hitbox margin.|Spears are now sorted before [[axe]]s in the Creative inventory.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre3|Spear charge attack animations and sounds can now only play every 0.5 seconds (10 ticks). If a charge attack connects more than once before 0.5 seconds have passed, no animation is played and no sound is heard.|While charging in first person, the spear head now gradually rotates to a fully vertical position over time, matching the behavior in third person.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre4|Spears now have their attack range increased by 2 when in Creative Mode, like other weapons, totaling to 6.5.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre5|Charge attacks done with spears in the offhand no longer trigger [[crushing blow]]s when holding an [[axe]] in the mainhand.}}

== Trivia ==
* Prior to the spear's addition to the base game, similar spears appeared in ''[[MCD:Spear|Minecraft Dungeons]]'', ''[[AMCM:Spear|A Minecraft Movie]]'', and [[A Minecraft Movie: Add-on|the add-on for ''A Minecraft Movie'']]. The latter depicted it being thrown like a [[trident]], which was a common suggestion for their implementation.
* Knockback from the spear can be dealt to some non-living entities that other weapons can't normally deal to, such as [[primed TNT]], [[boat]]s, and [[minecart]]s.{{check the code|Full list of entities}}
